Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Kaiserslautern
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Aachen
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Bad Wörishofen
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Würzburg
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Baden
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Zürich
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Pitchstorm: So Bad It's Good
Description: A cult movie expansion for Pitchstorm. "100-card Kickstarter-exclusive expansion based on the world's worst cult movies."

Name: Pitchstorm: Creature Feature
Description: A horror movie expansion for Pitchstorm. "For all the horror fans out there. This deck is full of characters and plots to add a dose of gore and suspense to your pitches."

Name: Pitchstorm: Date Night
Description: A romantic comedy expansion for Pitchstorm. "For the true romantics, the date night deck adds all of the romantic comedy tropes you didn't know your life was missing."

Name: Pitchstorm: Awards Season
Description: A very prestigious expansion for Pitchstorm. "This deck introduces Awards, which are a totally new type of card to the game. At the start of each round, the table draws three awards cards. Then at the end of the round, the table votes to give these awards to the movies that were produced that most earned the award (or who sent the nicest gift basket)."

Name: Pitchstorm: NC-17
Description: An XXX expansion for Pitchstorm: No one 17 and under admitted. "For the fans of dirty and/or offensive cards. This deck is stuffed full of inappropriate content that you should never show your family (unless your family is super cool)."

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Vulture-class Droid Fighter Expansion Pack
Description:
The Vulture-class Droid Fighter is the backbone of the Separatist Navy and emblematic of its strategy: weak in isolation, but overwhelming in numbers. A sufficiently vast swarm of networked attackers form a cunning, sinister intelligence that can defeat even wise and powerful Jedi pilots.

The Vulture-class Droid Fighter Expansion Pack contains everything you need to begin building your own squadron of linked droid starfighters—most importantly, a beautifully pre-painted Vulture-class droid fighter miniature. Additionally, five ship cards give you the ability to outfit your droid fighter with distinct types of programming while five upgrade cards provide even more freedom to shape your squadron.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Servants of Strife Squadron Pack
Description:
War! The Separatist Alliance has driven a spike into the heart of the galaxy, splintering the once-unified worlds with choas, tyranny, and fear. At the heart of this offensive is the dastardly General Grievous, commanding endless legions of droid fighters.

Swarms of networked Vulture-class fighters commanded by tactical droids strike at innocent worlds, forcing the Republic on the defensive. All the while, Grievous slinks through the shadows in his customized Belbullab-22 Starfighter; hunting the Jedi at every turn.

This Squadron Pack contains everything you need to add one Belbullab-22 Starfighter and two Vulture-class Droid Fighter ships to your games of X-Wing, including new ship and upgrade cards, three maneuver dials, and an array of tokens.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Monopoly: CASS Business School
Description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:
Centrally located in London between the old financial city and the thriving  hub of Tech City, Cass delivers innovative, relevant and forward-looking education, consultancy and research to the business to community.
This special edition game celebrates our strong links to the City of London, our dedication to excellence and our passion for business education.
We constantly seek new ways to serve our students and the global business community, and like a player of this game, we never stand still: we are alert, dynamic and creative.
Cass Business School is at the top of its academic game, so join the fun with our special edition Monopoly!

PROPERTIES
BROWN
Thomson Reuters / Bloomberg
LIGHT BLUE
Library / Careers Service / Alumni Relations 
PINK
Citysport / Students' Union / Student Clubs & Societies 
ORANGE
Faculty Of Actuarial, Science & Insurance / Faculty Of Management / Faculty Of Finance
RED 
??? / 200 Aldersgate / Bunhill Row
YELLOW 
London Stock Exchange / 30 St Mary Axe (The Gherkin) / Bank Of England
GREEN 
Tech City / Dubai Financial Centre / City Of London
DARK BLUE 
Centre For Entrepreneurship / Research Centres
STATIONS
Liverpool Street / Barbican / Moorgate / Old Street
UTILITIES
Travel / ???
TAXES
Textbooks / Tuition Fees
COMMUNITY CHEST / CHANCE
Community Chest / Chance

Name: Thomas Cook Snap Happy
Description:
The object of the game is to collect six location photographs from the eight locations on the board. The winner is the first to return home with six photos.

A trip ticket, taxi space, or die is used to get around the board, and at the hotel you may use in-game money to buy 24 film exposures. Once at a location a player stated number of exposures can then be used to pick up that number of picture cards in the hope the player gets a card that matches the location.

Once six location cards have been collected a player will then head to the home space. The first to reach the home space with six cards wins.

—user summary

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Delta-7 Aethersprite Expansion Pack
Description:
The Delta-7 Aethersprite is an elegant craft designed to help Jedi Knights cross the gulfs between the stars in their quest to uphold justice. Equipped with an astromech for navigation, it is lightly armed but highly maneuverable, its fine-tuned controls allowing a Force-sensitive pilot to fly it with unmatched precision.

With five ship cards—including four unique pilots—the Delta-7 Aethersprite Expansion Pack adds even more Jedi for you to include in your Galactic Republic squadrons, including the legendary Anakin Skywalker. Featuring an alternate paint scheme to ship included in the Guardians of the Republic Squadron Pack, this expansion also features six upgrade cards designed to get even more out of your ship and its Jedi pilots.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – ARC-170 Starfighter Expansion Pack
Description:
The ARC-170 is the Galactic Republic's mainstay heavy starfighter. Equipped torpedoes allow this intimidating craft to smash through foes that might repel the Republic's more lightly armed ships, while its rear gunner makes it difficult to approach from most angles. Whether defending the flanks of a formation or giving support to a Jedi General, the ARC-170 has an imposing presence on the battlefield.

With the ARC-170 Starfighter Expansion Pack, you can bring a single ARC-170 starfighter to your X-Wing battles. Alongside the beautifully painted ARC-170 miniature, you'll find six clone pilots ready to fly for the Republic as well as 14 upgrade cards giving you the freedom to add additional heavy weaponry, gunners, and crew members to your ship.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Guardians of the Republic Squadron Pack
Description:
War! The Galactic Republic reels from the blow dealt by the the fledgling Separatist Alliance. But even in this age of uncertainty and disunion, heroes arise. Legendary Jedi Knight Obi-Wan Kenobi valiantly leads dedicated clone pilots into battle against the forces of tyranny and chaos in the Guardians of the Republic Squadron Pack for X-Wing!

This pack gives you everything you need to begin building your Galactic Republic squadrons, including one Delta-7 Aethersprite miniature and two V-19 Torrent miniatures. The chosen interceptor of many Jedi, the Delta-7 allows them to use their Force-enhanced reflexes to the fullest. Behind them, clone pilots cover them from their V-19 Torrents with coordinated fire, tight formation flying, and salvoes of missilies. In addition to the miniatures, this Squadron Pack gives you the chance to further explore the potential of the Force with several new Force upgrade cards. Meanwhile, a wealth of other upgrade cards—including reprints of many common neutral upgrade cards—provide a wealth of options for customizing your squadrons.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – TIE/sk Striker Expansion Pack
Description:
Screaming through the atmosphere on nimble ailerons, the TIE/sk striker is a unique starfighter designed to excel at both air and space assaults. Its atmospheric capabilities give it unique and flexible movement patterns that can surprise even veteran opponents, as its heavy firepower lets it wear down nearly any foe.

With the TIE/sk Striker Expansion Pack, you have a new option for rounding out your Imperial squadrons. In addition to the fully assembled, pre-painted TIE/sk striker miniature, five pilots stand ready to swoop into battle and protect the Empire, while five upgrade cards give you the chance to further customize your squadrons.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Z-95-AF4 Headhunter Expansion Pack
Description:
The Z-95 Headhunter's wide production saw it scattered to the far corners of the galaxy. Now, this reliable, easy-to-acquire starfighter is integral to numerous criminal cartel fleets—from large operations like Black Sun to small-time raiders like the Binayre Pirates. Armed with missiles and illicit technologies, a single Z-95-AF4 can be a danger, but a swarm can be devastating.

Now, you have the chance to continue growing your Scum and Villainy squadrons with these inexpensive fighters. The Z-95-AF4 Headhunter Expansion Pack includes everything you need to add one Z-95-AF4 Headhunter ship to your squadron, including a miniature with a stunning new paint scheme, four ship cards, five upgrade cards, and a handful of tokens.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Cult Following: Cult Classics
Description:
Cult Following: Cult Classics is an expansion for Cult Following: The One True Game. This expansion includes 75 sign cards inspired by classical religions. Mix these cards in with the base game, or keep them separate to allow players the choice of regular or Cult Classics cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Cult Following: Not Safe For Worship
Description:
Cult Following: Not Safe For Worship is an expansion for Cult Following: The One True Game. This expansion includes 58 question cards and 17 sign cards that work well with adult themed cults. Mix these cards in with the base game, or keep them separate to allow players the choice of regular or NSFW cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Captain Underpants Sign Changing Game
Description:
Join George and Harold as they wreak havoc changing the signs everywhere! Earn the most items from Principal Krupp's confiscated items drawer by rearranging words into side-splitting, ultimate prankster phrases. Turn "Go Jerome Tigers" into "Go Roman Gods!"

A silly sport of side-splitting, sign-changing fun: includes 30 signs, three hint cards, 90 double-sided letter and blank tiles, dice, prankster items, and instructions.

Join George and Harold as they wreak havoc everywhere, pulling pranks and cracking jokes with whatever they can find.

Earn confiscated prankster goodies from Principal Krupp’s desk
Based on the popular book series and highly anticipated 2017 Dreamworks film, Captain Underpants: The First Epic Movie.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Rebel Specialists Personnel Expansion
Description:
Rebel commanders may be undermanned and underequipped, but they more than make up for this with resolve, tenacity, and sheer force of will. Leading by example, it's not uncommon for Alliance officers to wade into the thick of battle alongside their troops. When leading troops with specialized training, they can provide invaluable support to Rebel ground operations.

The Rebel Specialists Personnel Expansion for Star Wars: Legion contains four finely sculpted Rebel specialist miniatures, along with new unit, upgrade, and command cards that give you the power to field a generic Rebel commander and add troops with specialized training to other units in your army. Among them, you'll find a communications specialists, a medical droid, and an astromech droid, opening up even more tactical possibilities in your struggle against the Empire.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Imperial Specialists Personnel Expansion
Description:
Whether driven by creed or devotion to the Empire, Imperial Commanders are dangerous and cunning opponents, feeling no qualms about resorting to ruthless and violent tactics. These commanders can make a name for themselves on the battlefields of Star Wars: Legion by making the best use of the specialized personnel at their disposal to complete their objectives.

With the Imperial Specialists Personnel Expansion, you can field a generic Imperial Officer unit complete with three new command cards to add more tactical possibilities to your Imperial ground operations. Accompanying them are three specialists that can be added to other units in your army: a communications specialist to better coordinate with your troops, a medical droid to administer first aid to your troops, and an astromech droid to repair your vehicles on the fly.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: Imperial Assault – Coruscant Back Alleys Skirmish Map
Description:
While Coruscant is the center of the Star Wars galaxy, it is far from the safest place. In the undercity, far away from the eyes of the Emperor, skirmish battles rage on!

The Coruscant Back Alleys Skirmish Map is a 26" x 26" slip-resistant mat for use in Star Wars: Imperial Assault skirmish games, making set-up quick and allowing you to jump right into the action. This skirmish map takes your battles to the neon-soaked back alleys of Coruscant, where dark corners and narrow passageways make for tight-quarters combat. Two skirmish cards provide new ways to play.

—description from the publisher

Name: Portolano
Description:
The 16th century, the age of renaissance. Sailing and maritime trade are flourishing, vast fleets belonging to shipping companies are crossing the seas around the world. There is fierce competition for the available commodities which must be delivered to harbors. The shortest sea route may not be the easiest one. To achieve your goal in becoming the best captain, you need to find the best routes, deliver your goods to the harbor at the right moment and should not think twice to go raiding a little at times. Your portolan chart, a navigation map lies already in front of you, the crew is awaiting your order, and the race is just about to begin.

In Portolano, each players controls a ship at sea. With each step you move your ship to the next map tile (map consists of tiles randomly drawn at the beginning of the game). If this is a sea tile, the player can pick one resource (3 different goods or cannons) available on the island. Each sea tile allows for one additional special action. The most important one is ship building, letting players upgrade their ships, extend their cargo bay, increase their speed, or attacking power in battle.

Other possible actions include e.g. trading goods (change them to other goods or rum). Once you move to a harbor, you sell the goods collected on the islands to get coins (each harbor has differing needs for products). The more goods you can sell in one go, the  more coins you will get.

The players plan their next moves simultaneously, without knowing the plans of others. Therefore it may happen that a player moves to sea tile, where the goods are already taken by other players or to a harbor, where the demands have already been satisfied.

Once everybody has moved their ships in the round, the wind indicator will be spun, the new wind direction determines the next move of the pirates, who are also on the prowl at sea. After this, the movement phase ends. There is a battle after the movement phase if players and/or the pirate are positioned on the same/adjacent tiles. The fights use dice rolling, the winner steals goods/coins/rum from the loser.

Rum is considered to be an important commodity as well, it "fuels” the crew to sail the ship according to your orders. If any player runs out of rum, the crew rebels and the ship can move only in the direction that the wind takes it until the rum stock is refilled. The costs of moving the ship in terms of rum depends on your movement compared with the wind direction (upwind, tailwind, crosswind).

The game ends as soon as any of the goods run out. The player who has the most coins wins the game (coins can be collected even at the end of the game by unlocking bonuses).

Name: Aachoo!
Description:
Aachoo! is a bluffing game set in the ocean, in the battle between monk fish and its tasty prey. Each player is a monk fish who has 9 mouth locations, arranged in a 3x3 grid.  Players draw tiles, place fish on them either lying or telling the truth, and score more points for having all 3 colors of fish / tiles in a particular horizontal row.

When a player draws a tile, they examine it and then place it face down on the next open spot in their player's monk fish display. They then place a number of fish of one color on top of the tile. This claim can be either true or a lie. Going around the table, check whether another player wants to challenge the active player's claim. If challenged, the active player reveals the tile. If they were truthful, they keep the tile, but the challenger loses their most recent tile. If caught in a lie, the active player gives the tile and the bluff fish to the challenger, who places them in their next tile slot on their player board. In addition to the normal fish tiles, there are 2 special tiles which change up some of the results of the bluffing.

Play continues until all but one player has filled up all their slots, or until out of tiles.

Players score each horizontal row. In each row, they look at the colors of the fish (tokens or fish on tiles).  If all 3 colors are represented, then they score the number of all fish in that row. Otherwise, the row scores the number of tiles.

—description from the publisher

Name: Battle of RÖG
Description:
The Battle of RÖG (pronounced "rogue") is a trading card battle game featuring plastic character "cards" called "battlesnap cards" that laid flat when in an idle state, and then popped up into a sculpted plastic character when a button on the front of the plastic base was hit. The bottom of the cards feature wheels to allow them to be launched at each other. Each individual character has its own innate element (Fire, Earth or Fog) symbolized on the card base with a plastic badge that can be removed, allowing the elements to be switched out. The elements have strengths and weaknesses against each other, and the game is played in a rock-paper-scissors format with one element beating the other. Each character also comes with a set of detailed plastic coins for betting and wagering.

—user summary

Name: Qube: Afrikas stjerne
Description:
Play your cards right, and the Star of Africa will be yours.

This is a simple card version of Afrikan tähti, where you race to be the first to find the Star of Africa and reach the city of Tangers. In this small family friendly game you collect sets of matching colored cards to be the first to fulfill the goal and win the game. Each round you start with a fixed number of cards and play them to either hinder your opponents or get closer to the finish.
—user summary

Put the Qube on the table. Pull out the drawer and start the game immediately! The pursuit of the Star of Africa continues - a classic, now as an exciting card game.

Monkeys and robbers means trouble. Using the map, pickaxe and sets of diamonds in different colors will help you find the Star, the city of Tanger and get a visa. First one to get all three items wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Zombie Old Maid (ゾンババ)
Description:
Once, there was a woman who was too busy playing board games that she remained single throughout her life. (Board games do have such an appeal.) During her lifetime, she won prizes at all sorts of major game tournaments and became a billionaire.

Then a rumor spread that she lies in her coffin with game components made of gold, but time has passed without anyone finding that coffin. And, on this day, from among millions of games, you have found and acquired this coffin by spending a large sum of 500 yen. (Hurrah!)
However, you have opened the coffin and found out that the rumor about the gold components was not true, though it was not entirely false either. The coffin contains mysterious unknown components collected by the deceased from across the world over the years. And many of them are human figures. (Eek!) The woman, who has become a zombie, is trying to put a curse on you to turn you into a zombie. She is vexed to have died without playing enough games and therefore has a grudge against you, who opened this coffin so joyfully.

So now is the time to play this game and win it in order to nail in the coffin and put the zombie old maid into an eternal slumber. Well, do not fear. This is a simple game like any other Old Maid. All you need to do is just get rid of the cards in your hand quickly. Go ahead and break the curse with joy!

—description from the designer

In this Old Maid variant, pairs are made up of a color card and a  gray card. A player that has one of the two Zombie Old Maids has to show his gray cards to the other players. When drawing a card from him, other players can choose to draw one of his (concealed) color cards, or to choose one of his gray cards - but then they get the Zombie Old Maid too. The goal of the game is to be the first to empty your hand.

—user summary

Name: Team Team
Description:
As you might guess from the name, in Team Team you play in teams, with each team consisting of a speaker and a builder.

Each builder has a set of five tiles, with the tiles featuring five shapes, five colors, and five animals; each team's tiles have a different arrangement of these features. Each builder lays their tiles in a row in front of themselves, and they want to arrange these tiles in a pattern known only by the speaker, with the pattern being the same for all teams.

At the start of a round, one of the speakers reveals a sound card, such as "Woof!" or "Bong!", then they place a pattern card on a display that is visible only to the speakers. The pattern might be 3-5 animals in a row, 3-5 shapes in a row, or 3-5 colors in a row. Play then begins. Each builder starts by placing a finger on two different tiles, then their speaker will:


    Make the sound once — Bong! — if the builder should finger different tiles.
    Make the sound twice — Bong! Bong! — if the builder should switch the fingered tiles.
    Make the sound thrice — Bong! Bong! Bong! — if all of the tiles are arranged properly. At this point, the builder slaps the multicolored tile in the center of the table. If this team's tile arrangement is correct — and with only 3-4 tiles depicted on a pattern card, the tiles must be in the proper order and adjacent to one another — then they claim the pattern card as a point. If they are incorrect, then each other team scores a point.


The first team to score 3 points wins.

Name: Flipside Jam
Description:
Flipside Jam is a lightning quick, fun card drafting game for 2 to 5 players.

Pick wonderful and wild music stars as they roar around your table. 
Pass the rest of the cards to the opponent on your left.
Simultaneously Flip the card to reveal your selections.

Think fast to outwit your opponents and select the best card combos to score the most points. The player with the most points after 3 rounds is the winner.

Can you roar to the top of the music world?

—description from the publisher

Name: Collusion: The Card Game
Description:
A contemporary variation on the classic game of Clue (Cluedo) crossed with the Trump-Russia collusion scandals. It is simultaneously humorous political satire and yet an engaging fully playable game with more complexity than the original.

This card and board game contains many new innovations such as an action-point based system of movement between locations, the requirement that other player-suspects be subpoenaed with an action point (and the ability of other players to resist being moved by subpoena), and the Pardon Power--the ability to pardon the the guilty suspect to alter the game's logic mid-game. The game is played both collaboratively and competitively with other players.

Each player is a Special Agent on a FBI team investigating clues at potential crime scenes from New York and Washington to London and Moscow. Each player is assigned one of eight suspects to tail around the world, and also has subpoena power to summon one other suspect each turn to a potential crime scene.

Players use logic to separate out the merely scandalous from the criminally scandalous, and work to bring an indictment against the correct suspect in one scandal at one scene. The indictment must be correct, or the team will lose the game--and the country.

Ideally, you would like to be the first Special Agent to discover the correct indictment, but any agent on the team can win for the good of the country.

Remember, the clock is ticking. If the team makes Donald Trump too angry, he might exercise the Pardon Power. And if the investigation drags on too long, then all will truly be lost...

—description from the publisher

Name: Yōkai Quest: Epic Boss o-Goryo Sama
Description:
A new epic boss o-Goryo Sama brings a new challenge to your games. 
More miniatures! More enemies! More gameplay!

Name: Yōkai Quest: Mystic Forest
Description: The second expansion for YÅkai Quest allows you to face with the forces of mystic forest and brings 2 new heroes to play, new items and adventures.

Name: Bucket of Doom: Toxic Edition
Description:
Your favourite storytelling card game is back, with more dark humour than ever AND a toxic twist.

Not familiar with the Bucket of Doom? Where have you BEEN?! This thrilling 17+ card game is one you really don’t want to lose. Let us explain:

Step 1: Read out one of the doom cards to discover what sort of mess you're in - for example, let's say you're trapped in the Death Star garbage crusher and the walls are closing in.

Step 2: Take a look at your 8 useless object cards. These could be anything, from a severed finger or Heather Mills’ false leg, to a pantomime horse outfit or Elton John’s favourite toupee. Come up with a cunning escape plan and share it with your fellow players - remember to be convincing, inventive, and a little bit absurd.

Step 3: Vote on who had the best plan, the one with the most votes wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: しぇすた・で・しゃ (Cat Nap)
Description:
ã—ã‡ã™ãŸãƒ»ã§ãƒ»ã—ã‚ƒ, which is pronounced approximately "Sieste de Chat" and which translates as Cat Nap, is a press-your-luck dexterity game in which players gently place (plastic) ducks one by one on a cat's tummy while the cat's taking a nap.

After placing a duck at rest, draw a card to see where and how the cat twitches in its sleep, trying to ensure that the ducks won't fall.

Name: Puppy Poo!
Description:
18-card mini-game. 
Mechanics: take-that, hand management, player-elimination.

A single pack of 18 plays 2-4 players...but adding more packs expands player count, all the way up to an unlimited number of players (recommended 12 max) making it a party game. 3 packs play up to 12.

Deck contains 2 (per pack being used) of POO! cards, catch another player with one in their hand, and they are out. Last player standing gets match-point. First to 3 (or agreed to larger number for a longer game) wins. Use attack cards to accuse, defense cards to survive, shifting cards to move POO! to other players.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wergild: Blood Revenge
Description:
Heap corn upon rivals in his stratege game of heather rituals. Imerse yourselve in the of Asgard. Valhala is culling!

angle over ambitons at feasts. Raid fom icy fjords of  in Spring. Pioner new rafts in butter weather by discovering innovations. Foster community sprite in trade and explain or conker the lands, in this hearted game of cold blooded!

ergild is an antiuity game of can rivary. riend and foe contest outlanish tiles, decoating them in nomdick discover with lustations that inspire blood feuds to be waged across landcapes The game is played in fur grounds repreenting ears. The ears are  into fur turns known as sarsons. layers represent one of the chef clams competing for scarce esources. Discover repreented by an pile packed with quirk cons. The hest score in blod money when the game ends ins!

Name: Bomb's Away
Description:
Bomb's Away is a card game for 2-4 players that is a combination of Waterworks and Uno. To win Bombs Away, you must be the first player to play all your cards.

Bomb's Away can be played with additional players, provided there is one deck for every four additional players.

—user summary

Bomb's Away is played with up to 4 players with a unique 75 card deck. Place the Hydrant Card in the center of the playing surface and choose a dealer. Shuffle the deck, then deal each player ten (10) cards face down.

The player to the dealer's left lays one Pipe Card on the table, connecting it to the Hydrant Card. All Pipe Cards must be played in the same orientation as the Hydrant Card (pipes and card edges maintaining congruency) New pipes may connect to same-colored Pipe Cards at the 'open' end of a pipe. A Pipe Card cannot connect 2 different colored pipes, unless the Pipe Card is Wild. The placement of a Pipe Card cannot block an 'open' pipe.

If the current player cannot play a card, they draw until receiving a playable card. Each player takes a turn in a clockwise fashion around the table. This process repeats until one player has zero cards remaining. If every card is used before a player wins, all discarded cards are shuffled and returned to the deck pile.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Dog Game
Description:
The Dog Game is the "pawesome" family board game (with doggos)! This game asks the question dog lovers have pondered for years: "what do dogs think about?" Easy to learn and full of hilarious fun, the game begins as players compete to match doggo thoughts to crazy canine pictures. Players vote on the best answer, and whoever wins gets a doggy treat! With three possible categories to choose from, you can select Dog Thoughts, Doggo Dilemmas or Pupper Pals. Choose a Dog Thought card and everyone selects a dog picture to match. Draw a Doggo Dilemmas card and players get creative! Using Dry-Erase Cards and Markers, everyone fills in the blank on the prompt card with a silly word or phrase! Select Pupper Pals and players choose the dog that would most likely belong to the person mentioned on the card. Play The Dog Game and you could find out answers to the most pressing dog questions like: "What is the meaning of Life?""Do good and evil exist?""Who's a good boy?" Answer these doggy questions and you could win the most treats!

—description from the publisher

Name: Peek a Boo
Description:
You play roles of "Clowns" and a "Child".
The Clown player gains points if the Child laughs. The Child player gains points if not laughing.
The player with most points wins the game.

—description from the designer

Name: NOCCA x NOCCA
Description:
An easy-to-learn, quick-to-play abstract game containing 5 black and 5 white dice. The board is simply a 5×8 grid. All five white and black dice begin the game on their respective sides. You can win the game one of two ways:


     Move one die of your color to the opponents goal (This area is behind the starting line)
     Have all five of your dice on top of the other opponents.


On your turn you must move one of your dice to any orthagonal or diagonal space adjacent to this die. You may move your die on top of one or two (stacked dice). This means you will then create a stack of two or three, unless the space was empty.  You may not create a stack of four. You can also move your cube on top of any stack to an adjacent space.

It takes 5-10 minutes per game, but the moves demand much attention and cleverness.

Name: Board×Break
Description:
3 Soldier piece VS 3 Soldier piece survival SLG Boardâœ–ï¸ŽBreak!
A large volume of 76 cards, 10 bodies, 1 dice, 1 board, 1 field sheet, 20 wall blocks!Team play of 2 people in one set and 4 people in 2 sets is possible.

Clear rules
Defeat all opponent 's soldiers, reach the opponent' s trout, or destroy it will be victory.

Rich card
Avoid attacks, extend distance of attacks, build walls, climb up to attack and use for avoidance. By choosing 12 cards from various cards, you can build your own deck, put a great card, you can summon soldiers with special ability to the field.
Please aim at victory by using various great people such as Billy the kid and Hannibal Barca.

A little luck
You can draw one card from every turn deck, but you can also draw a card from the square in the item box that is located in the field. This will allow you to expect speedy game development. Although it is said that the range of attack is dice luck and it is not a translation that the desired card can absolutely subtract, but let's overcome with love, courage and wisdom. But if you mention the range of attack alone, establishment will go up if you approach the other party.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wedding Ring
Description:
You are a bride and a bridegroom and relive a game that was played at wedding ceremony in a long time ago.
In that game, roses and rings were used. The first player that moved a ring to the opponent's ring finger became a winner.
Then a loser had to tell a point he/she loved.

In this matchbox game, there is no rule like that a loser has to do something.
But how about telling your heart if you play this with a significant person?

—description from the designer

Name: Hunt Master
Description:
Hunt Master is a thrilling game of monster-hunting, deduction and bluffing for 2-4 players. Players travel to creepy locations and hunt for creatures of the night to assist them in defeating their opponents. A player's goal is to locate five monsters of a specific monster-type (Cryptid, Undead, Paranormal or Humanoid) before their opponents assemble their legion of monsters. At locations, monsters hide within Hunt Decks that also hold a variety of action cards that keep the game moving.  Players secretly make decisions about what they find while exploring, using the knowledge they've gained to track their monsters and prevent opponents from locating their monsters.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Combatants
Description:
The Combatants

(Les combattants) This is the story of the back alleys in the big cities, the grasslands at the outskirts of the rural areas, the field of the duel at dawn, the meetup of fighters in the park. The game of swashing blades, rivalling schools and swordplay and the bash of combatants in battle. You are the duelling gentlemen, the nobles, the privateers, the henchmen, the thugs and fighters of the streets. Trying to defend your honour, prove your loyalty, do your master’s biddings or just to survive. Pick up your sword and roll your dice.

This is the narrative of duelling. Duelling in the sense of swordmasters, fighting styles, sunset duelling and honour. You are a fighter with a specific style and your school. Combat is both luck and skill.

Manage your opportunities and movement, and you will come out on top. Whittle down your opponent's stamina in order to score hits, chase your opponent away from the battle, knock your opponent out and win the duel.

 Base concept 

Combatants in a melee or a duel are constantly manoeuvring, in and out of each other's range, accelerating, slowing down, changing directions. Swordplay is like a dance in that you are moving and responding to your opponents, but you also try to outsmart them and to hit them or to keep them far away. The combat, distance, and turn order in this game is an abstraction. There is no fixed amount of time per round or turn, nor a fixed distance between players. The aim of this game is to both be a tool in a narrative and like a game of duelling, you would even be able to play this as a regular board game, player versus player, teams versus teams or in a Battle Royal style.

 Gameplay 

In this game of duelling, your goal is to knock out or chase your opponent away from the battleground. Various stories may drastically change winning conditions and combat is not always the answer. But this time and in this story, it will solely be a story about the duels.

Once each turn, players will simultaneously roll several six-sided dice and allocate these as the attack, defence and action values. One selected die, and in addition to this, dice combinations will give a final combat value. To aid you during gameplay there will be cards displayed as a playerboard, to visualize and present your decisions, both to yourself and other players.

Each combatant will have a combat skill level and each skill level will gain you one combat die to roll. The combat skill will range between zero and nine and the most common level is between two and four. In addition to this, there may be bonus dies, and sometimes dice are removed from play or temporarily locked down.

Independent of how many dice you roll, only ONE of the combat dice is chosen and with its full value be used as the base combat value. The rest of the dice will be used in dice combinations, to either increase this base value or be used for actions. When you choose to perform any one of the various actions instead of, or at the same time as your general melee, dice will be used for action quality instead of as part of the final combat result.

The combat value is used both as your chance to avoid being struck by ANY opponents and as your chance to land a blow at ONE opponent. These values are compared between players to see who succeeds. The difference between values is the quality of the blow, and are used for fatigue and damage.

When a combatant is attacked by several opponents, the combatant’s combat result will count as the defence value against them all, fully or partially lowering potential damage, regardless of it is a successful or failed onfall against any of the opponents.

If you are up against and is attacking several potential opponents, you have to declare who is your main target, as you could only have one main opponent each turn. As a combatant is attacking for damage, gets a higher result, and thereby succeeds with the onfall against one, lower this opponent's stamina by the difference between the two results minus any penalty from distance. Turn order and actions may interfere with the attack, distance and protection may change the level of fatigue and damage.

To be used as fatigue and damage level trackers, there will be three blue health dies placed on your character card. As your combatant gets hit, reduce the value on the health dies one at the time, equal to the quality of the blow. Starting with the topmost die, continuing until the whole value is accounted for. The difference between combat values are the quality of a blow.

As soon as a die is down to zero you remove it. A removed die will reveal a penalty written on your character card. The values of these health dies will differ between characters and are based on a combatants’ constitution. Your combattant will be knocked out if all of your three health dice are removed.

At the beginning of every new turn, you reroll all of your available unlocked combat and bonus dice. Change your turn order. You allocate your dice as combat value and dice combinations. Priority of placed dice, onfalls, defences and actions are resolved in an order determined by a cycling sequence of timeslots. These timeslot sequences are determined by fighting styles and timeslot positions range between one to nine. Higher timeslot number is later in the turn.

Each fighting style sequence does not consist of all available timeslot positions, only a few and it varies between styles. You may voluntarily choose to act later within your own fighting style sequence for a bonus; as recovering stamina or focus and gaining additional combat dice.

There is no death in this game if you not specifically choose to incorporate this. If you want to tell a more deadly story, you may allow for serious consequences, as permanent injuries, maiming and coup de grâce.

—description from the designer

-Quotes

Inigo Montoya wrote:
My name is Inigo Montoya. This is a good game. Prepare to roll a die!

Fiore de'Liberi da Premariacco wrote:
This is the flower among games!

Jörg Wilhalm wrote:
You can not beat me in my own game, but you could in this!

George Silver wrote:
This game is as good as my own manual, a good introduction to the Art of Swordplay!

Name: The Great War: French Tanks Expansion
Description:
The Great War French tank booster pack - contains 2 x assembled and basic painted 1/100th scale (15mm) tank models. One each:

     St Chamond
     Schneider


They can be used together with the base set, the French Army, and the Tank expansion.

Name: マジョリ (Majori)
Description:
User summary
ãƒžã‚¸ãƒ§ãƒª (Majori) is a party game with a werewolf style of play. Players are given two options, and everyone pretends to be in support of the majority choice. But if a player is not convincing enough, they might be voted out as a minority supporter. If the player was actually a majority supporter, all minority supporters win. If the player was a minority supporter, the one with the most votes loses.

—description from the designer

     Open the theme (exampe: A. Coke B. Pepsi).
     Which do you like? Place your card (A or B) face down.
     Shuffle the cards & Open them up.
     A minority must not exist in this world.
     Everyone defends the Majority choice.
     If you are minority, you pretend to be majority.
     Everyone thinks about who is minority.
     Ready, set, go! We point toward the person you estimated as minority.
     We will open the card of the person with the most votes.
     Result:


He is a majority : minority win
He is a minority : person with most votes lose

The game consists mostly of 25 double-sided fish cards which show one of 5 fish cards on each side (can be the same on both sides, can be different). These cards are spread out on the table. One player starts and places a boat token on a fish card, then flips up another fish card. If that card shows the same fish, they place another fish on the new card, etc. If the card shows a different fish, it's the next player's turn to pick a fish card. The player who places the ninth boat removes all the marked cards and gets coins from a market board. In the second round, the goal is to flip up the seventh fish; in the third round, the fifth; and in the fourth round, the third. Bonus points are awarded for correctly predicting the fish on the final remaining card. Whoever has most coins at the end of the game is the winner.

Name: Picture Pathway
Description:
Picture Pathway is a game of visual perception where players attempt to collect the most cards by forming Pathways. A Pathway is a chain of three or more cards where similar adjacent cards can be linked together by the number of nodes of the shape, the color of the shape, and the shade of the background. There are two ways to play picture Pathway: The Longest Pathway and Find Your Pathway.

In The Longest Pathway, players compete simultaneously to see who can most quickly find the longest Pathway in a set of twenty-five cards.

In Find Your Pathway, players take turns trying to complete Pathways between specific cards. Players receive an origin, inhibitor, and destination card to determine each player's individual goals. Each turn a player can flip a picture card, place a color token, replace their inhibitor card, or remove a picture card to work towards forming their Pathway.

-description from designer

Name: Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood of Venice – Roma
Description:
Discover 4 new assassins! You can play them in the main campaign from the core box.

The assassins will explore the city of Rome in search of a hidden artifact. The enemies will also be unique to this expansion and will include Papal Guards and Followers of Romulus.

Name: Empires of the Void II: General Event Cards
Description:
These General Event Cards came from the The Red Raven Fan Box #1 obtained at BGGCon2018. They make it easier to set up the power deck.

Includes 8 cards and a set up card.

Name: Haven: Ancient Relics
Description:
Included in the The Red Raven Fan Box #1 obtained at BGGCon 2018.

A six card expansion that states: at the start of the game give each player a random Ancient Relic card. It is a secret and can be played at any time during your turn.

Includes 6 cards and one set of instructions card.

Name: Eight-Minute Empire: Legends – Goal Cards
Description:
Included in the The Red Raven Fan Box #1 obtained at BGG Con 2018

Includes 4 cards and a instructional card that states: Place the goal cards face up next to the board. Players may claim these cards when they meet the requirements listed. Worth 3 VP at the end.

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Panama/Corsica
Description:
This is the first pair of new maps for 2018:


     Panama has special goods arrival near the canal, but you need to control the canal to get its benefits...



     Corsica the only place where black cubes represent the Corsican sense of independence. Certain regions of this island are going more and more challenging to urbanize and develop than others...


-description from designer

Name: Age of Steam Expansion: Iceland/Texas
Description:
This is the second pair of maps released in 2018:


     Texas: the enormous oil deposits must be exploited to the fullest!
     Iceland: Steam issues from the ground and warms its inhabitants... before it condenses into water again; This expansion permits you to experience the aging of steam!


-description from designer

Name: Strontium Dog: Rulebook
Description:
Strontium Dog is a skirmish tabletop battle game for two or more players set in the Strontium Dog universe defined by legendary comic creators John Wagner and Carlos Ezquerra. In it, Mutant Search/Destroy agents - the Strontium Dogs - are bounty hunters in a dangerous universe full of outlaws, pirates, and corruption. The Strontium Dogs' official sanction from the Galactic Crime Commission lets them operate across many worlds and jurisdictions - even time itself - yet they are hated and feared not just by the criminals they hunt but by normal people as well.

In Strontium Dog, players take control of a small team of bounty hunters or the outlaws, criminals and renegades they hunt in gun battles, chases and showdowns across the galaxy.

This book contains all the rules you need to play Strontium Dog including scenarios, advanced rules, and profile lists to create your own Bounty Hunters and gangs for them to hunt.

Name: 人外の代理人 (Agent of Evildoers)
72 (ななじゅうに) (72 Demons of Goetia)
GRUZILLA
Description:
A shiver of terror passed through the entire city.
Gruzilla, known to some only from legends, woke up from sleep.
The roaring apocalypse hung over the poor inhabitants of Silesian towns.
Can you help them?
Face the monster and stop him from destroying the land of coal.

During the game you have to prepare the "Wodzionka" soup to calm the beast's appetite before it destroys the city.

During their turn the players will try to acquire 4 of the 5 ingredients available in order to prepare the soup. To do this each player, in turn, will have to draw 2 cards from the deck then he can:
- play one of the cards in his hand applying the effects;
- Activate one of the "Object" cards previously played to apply their effects;
- take up to 2 ingredients playing 3 cards of the same color (ingredient)

The player who first collects 4 ingredients wins.

Name: Balloon Night
Description:
Fantastic night with the air-balloon!
Everyone watches the night sky.
Tonight, it’s the Balloon Night! The air shines in the night sky with the burner.
The air-balloons make the specific figure, Mount-Fuji, Sakura and Nishiki-Koi! That’s an oriental!
Can the pilots make them for the people to be fever?
The balloon is inflating with a hot air. But the wind affects with it.So the order of flying an air-balloon is at random. The pilots try to anticipate the order, and make the figures!

Name: Cottingley Fairies
Description:
ã‚³ãƒ†ã‚£ãƒ³ã‚°ãƒªãƒ¼ãƒ•ã‚§ã‚¢ãƒªãƒ¼ã‚ºã€€ï½žå¦–ç²¾ã®è¦‹ã¤ã‘æ–¹ï½ž

In this game, players are exploring the forest near Cottingley, looking for the elusive Fairy Circles. Arthur Conan Doyle believed in the famous photographs of the Cottingley Fairies, taken in 1917. Can you find them too?

Forest cards are turned up, and players bid to win a card in a blind auction. Each player hides some Explorer coins in their fist; players bidding most choose their Forest card first.

The Forest card has 6 areas, some have mushrooms in them, red or white or yellow. The player gets to place the card how they want, exploring the forest as they go. When a player completes a Fairy Circle, a ring of mushrooms all of one type, they score points. The larger the space surrounded by the circle, the more points they win. There are bonus points too if one the Fairies is present in the circle.

Name: Doctor Who Fluxx: Coin & Doctors
Description: Doctor Who Fluxx: Coin & Doctors is a small expansion for Doctor Who Fluxx that contains the long-awaited 13th Doctor as well as The War Doctor, which was previously released as a promotional item. This expansion also features an enameled turn token, along with a rule card that references the token and keeps players' eyes on the game since they could be penalized otherwise.

Name: Reichbusters: Projekt Vril – Not of this Earth!
Description:
A vril-powered portal tears the fabric of space and time, opening a door into an alien world. Lead your Heroes against both Nazis and aliens, discover their ancient secrets, and even explore the strange world beyond the portal itself!


     34 new minis
     20 cards
     8 modular raid mission cards
     4 campaign missions
     13 tiles

Name: Reichbusters: Projekt Vril – Projekt X
Description:
Kickstarter exclusive expansion.

With the ultimate power source in their hands, the Nazis have built the ultimate war machine: Projekt X. Once they have perfected it, mass production will commence and the Allied forces will be crushed under its steel feet. Unless you can stop it!


     1 new mini
     2 double-sided unit cards
     3 modular raid mission cards
     1 campaign mission

Name: Bolt Action: Korea
Description:
A new supplement bringing Bolt Action to a new period and conflict, the Korean War, with special rules, forces and scenarios to game this conflict.

This supplement for Bolt Action expands the rules-set from its World War Two roots to this new, and truly modern, conflict. Bolt Action: Korea contains all the rules, Theatre Lists, scenarios, and new and exciting units, never seen in Bolt Action before, to wargame this turbulent period of world history.

Name: Bolt Action: Campaign – Fortress Budapest
Description: As the Soviet Red Army marches westward, the city of Budapest stands in their way. Encircled and severely outnumbered, the German and Hungarian forces attempt to resist the Soviet juggernaut and defend Festung Budapest to the last. This book brings the siege of Budapest to the table-top with in-depth information on the forces involved, linked scenarios, and new Theatre Selectors that make this an ideal resource for any Bolt Action player with an interest in the the Eastern Front and the fall of the Reich.

Name: Bolt Action: Campaign – D-Day: Overlord
Description: Normandy, 6 June 1944. The Allies undertake the largest and most ambitious amphibious landings in history to return the fight to Western Europe. This new Campaign Book for Bolt Action allows players to take command of both Allied forces assaulting the beaches and inland defences and those of the axis manning such fortifications. New, linked scenarios, rules, troop types, and Theatre Selectors provide plenty of options for novice and veteran players alike.

Name: Reality's Edge: Cyberpunk Skirmish Rules
Description:
Set in a dystopian cyberpunk future, players take on the role of a data-jack, a mercenary hacker who leads a small team of trusted operatives and disposable freelancers. Funded by shadow backers, the data-jacks accept jobs from faceless clients for profit, glory, and better chrome ... always better chrome.

Battles take place in the concrete jungle known as the Sprawl, but data-jacks must remain wary of the threat posed by Cyberspace. Hacking rules are pivotal to the game, with data nodes, robots, machines, and even enemy chrome presenting potential targets for a cunning data-jack. No-one plugged into Cyberspace is entirely safe from intrusion, and the electronic sprites and digital djinn you can deploy alongside your team can be just as dangerous as any mercenary or assassin.

Gameplay focuses on individual characters, with each skirmish offering you the opportunity to earn experience and equipment for your data-jack and operatives. A wide range of items and upgrades are available, from advanced weaponry and synthetics through to cyber-implants, biological enhancements, clones, and much more. This is a world obsessed with whether something can be done, not whether it should.

—description from the publisher

Name: Route to India
Description:
It’s spring 1530. More than 30 years have passed since Vasco da Gama found the sea route to India around Africa. By order of the King of Portugal, you embark on a mysterious journey following the famous explorer’s trail. If you want to win the monarch’s admiration and his favour, you must visit as many overseas ports as you can, bringing home the most valuable cargo. There’s only one problem. Some goods go bad really rapidly. This is why you have to store them appropriately in your ship’s cargo hold, to make sure most of them stay fresh when they reach the port back in Lisbon. Time to set sail. May the best servant of the King win!

Route to India is a family friendly game (which also has an advanced version of the rules) for 2-4 players in which the participants embark on a journey to India and back. The gameplay is divided into two phases, composed of a number of turns which the players take. In the first phase your ships leave from the port of Rastello. Sailing along, you will be moving your ships to the selected ports or colonies (different types of spaces on the board), purchasing goods for doubloons and placing them in the cargo holds (player boards). During your turn you can take move and trade actions, and each cargo tile you obtain is worth a specific number of points at the end of the game. The last ship that arrives at the port in India starts the second phase, beginning the journey back (with new goods available). The game goes on until all the players’ ships reach Rastello again, then you count the points and the player with the highest score is the winner.

Name: Sugar Ponies
Description:
Description from the back of the box: Each player takes their pasture of sugar ponies and competes in a game of "whose-deck-is-bigger" where you try to outlast your friends so you can claim victory, and perhaps even more importantly, the bragging rights.

Your objective is to outlast your friends. You win by being the last Pony standing. If you run out of cards in your deck and your hand, you lose.

Sugar Ponies is played in a series of rounds and is a form of trick taking game. You win a round if you have the strongest Pony in play at the beginning of your next turn. You can play 1 card per turn and must play a card on your first turn. Every turn after that, you have the option to drop out of the round and not play any more cards. The winner of the round can take as many Ponies from the Playing Field as they can hold (max hand size is 5) and then the rest of the cards played in that round are discarded. The winner of that round then starts the next round.

Name: Boom
Description:
A rowdy game for a party of friends of explaining famous persons.

How to play?


     Several cards with persons are distributed. 
     The famous ones are selected and are left in the common pack.
     During one go the team has a right to take the card out of the pack, try to explain it and in case of success to take the next card till the sandglass will empty.
     The team which explains better by the results of three rounds is the winner.


The first round – explanation in words, e.g. “A boy whose nose gets longer when he lies”, the second round – in dumb show (to show a nose or something else), the third round – in one word: “nose”.

Why don’t the players digress during others’ go?

They don’t digress because during the game set the same cards are used, i.e. unlike the other party games all the players are in game even during another team’s go: most probably they in the next round or immediately during next go they will have to explain the person that another team has failed to explain. It is also important to keep all the personages in mind because they are passing from one round to another.

Whom is this game destined to?

Boom suites ideally the parties (it is rowdy and for any group of people), it is good in trip (doesn’t require a table), is often used as an office game (contributes to teambuilding) and also suites the children for personal enrichment. As far as the box contains a big book with the personages this game may also be used as a family educative one.

—description from the publisher

Name: Martial Cards
Description:
Martial Cards is a fun and quick card game inspired by martial arts, video games, and movies of the 80’s and 90’s. In this two-player, turn-based, hand management style fighting card game, players will pick a character deck and challenge their friends to a martial arts match. Players take turns executing attacks and enhancements until one of them is reduced to zero life and the other is standing as victor!

-description from designer

Name: The Stygian Society: The Cursed Library
Description:
In this expansion to The Stygian Society, the heroes are famous authors trying to fight their way through the Cursed Library in an attempt to defeat the villain who had brought the authors' vilest characters to life. As they progress through the library and defeat foes, they can recruit good characters using ink. These characters will fight on behalf of the heroes, but are just as susceptible to damage, so the heroes must fight wisely as they climb.

Contents:

4 Authors, each having 1 Author Mat and 12 Special Cards (6 characters and 6 abilities)
4 Final Boss Mats
4 Mid Boss Mats
6 Lower Floor Cards
6 Upper Floor Cards
36 Book Cards (Double Sided).    There are three for each floor, and each is double sided with a good guy on one side and a bad guy on the other
Additional Wooden Health Tokens
Wooden Ink Tokens
12 Status Cars (3 for each hero)

Name: The Stygian Society: The Tower Laboratory
Description:
The Tower Laboratory takes place in America during the early part of the 20th century. Four new heroes include the psychic, mechanic, electrical engineer, and chemist. Each has a new accompanying set of skills!

This expansion also includes two new mini-bosses, two new bosses (including the mad scientist), a bunch of new enemies, and lots more treasure!

Contents:

4 hero mats
28 hero skill cards
10 purple cubes
1 cardboard hero party marker standee
2 boss mats
2 mini-boss maps
5 lower room cards
5 upper room cards
12 enemies
8 lower treasure cards
8 upper treasure cards
The Tower Laboratory short story by Elaine Cunningham
Kickstarter-exclusive mid-boss (Sand Golem)
Kickstarter-exclusive main boss (Ghost in the Machine)

Name: The Stygian Society: Dark is the Night Hunter Hero
Description:
The hunter from the 2017 game, Dark is the Night game is now a fully-playable hero in The Stygian Society!

Contains 1 hero mat and 15 hero skill cards.

Name: Elder Shadows
Description:
Times are dark and sinister agents move in the shadows. Can you stop the Elder Ones from awakening?

In this 2-player asymmetrical card game, one player investigates several locations for indications of Cultist activity. Facing maddening dangers and grotesque specters, the Investigators duty is two-fold - find out what horrors lurk in the shadows and stop them. Be clever and investigate rumors to gather insight before the cult can awaken an Elder One.

The Cultist sets perilous traps, summons fearful specters and casts reality warping spells to prevent the Investigator from discovering the secrets of the Elder Shadows.

Each player is given a set amount of action during their turn to use as best they see fit. Will you draw cards or Investigate? Will you summon a Specter or set a trap? In a devious twist to standard card games, Elder Shadows implements a unique Sanity system making all cards more, or less, powerful based on the current Sanity level.

Can you expose the Cult before they can open the gateway to unimaginable horror?

Name: Mage Wars Academy: Druid Expansion
Description:
In this expansion set, play as a verdant Druid whose skillfully tended plants and carefully crafted potions show that the natural way is the best! Game play is quick and exciting, with tough tactical decisions and devious surprises every round!

Players can customize their spellbook with exciting spells from this and other Mage Wars products. Summon mighty plants and swarms of insects, brew potent potions, and release the strength of nature!

2 Mage Cards
70 Spell Cards
Game Markers
Rules and Codex

Name: Easy Profit Game
Description:
The point of the game is to complete a profitable (or not) year in business. The result of playing the game is an enhanced understanding of the basic financial tools commonly used in business. The participants make up a team of executives for a fictitious company (can also be played individually).

The flow of the game is that each player or team of players make up a company that lives through a year in business, one month at a time. They run into many opportunities and some of those opportunities become obstacles if they do not respond to them correctly. And, the team has to deal with annoying things that happen in business like paying bills and dealing with an employee that steals from you or spending money on something that was not anticipated. Each month, the team completes that months section on a P&L, Balance Sheet and Statement of Cash flows.

During the process, players are interacting with our website, their team and other teams and all of these relationships have an effect on the outcome of the game. The team with the most profit at the end of the game (year) WINS!

To start the game, the players must divide into teams. Each team being made of 1-3+ players. Teams can be bigger for large groups but 3 is the ideal largest team size. The teams name their company and roll dice to determine which side of the game board to play on (franchise vs. non-franchise) and from there, the players reference the "play now" section of the website to capture their region info to note on the main game board before they begin the first turn.

Each turn equals a month in business. The game lasts for 12 months (1 year) but the first quarter (3 months) has already been completed so the teams actually begin in April using Jan-Mar as a template for how to proceed.

Each team begins by rolling a dice to determine if they pull a "sales" card or a "company" card. Sales cards tend to lead to better results but not always. Following the instructions on the sales card, the team proceeds with completing the income sheet for that month. They then use those results to complete the balance sheet and then the cash flow statement.

Finally, they check the economic health of the other teams in their community to see if they are growing or declining which effects their income for the following turn (month).

This cycle continues in and through December where the winner is determined based on their total earnings, cash at the bank and owners equity.

Despite all the financial terms the game is both realistic and fun to play for families or professionals.

—description from the publisher

Name: C.O.G.: Shifting Gears
Description:
C.O.G.: Shifting Gears is an 9-card pack that transforms the base game C.O.G. into a quicker and more portable version without sacrificing any of the interesting and intriguing aspects of the original game.

C.O.G: Shifting Gears converts COG into a portable game by replacing the game's main board with a few cards.  This variant also shortens the game by changing the goal into a race to complete words, as opposed to a competition over victory points.  Also, instead of completing the usual 10 or more words per game, the game ends when a player has completed only 4 words.  However, using the goal tiles from the original game, you can add variety by changing both the words and the number of words.

-description from designer

Name: BonDing
Description:
BonDing is a science-themed card game set in the world of ChemCaper. Players aim to 'bond' as many Petticles as possible with their cards before the game ends. There are different kinds of bonds, elements and Petticles in the game that can be found and bonded together.

A number of petticles will be available for the player to attempt and bond.

To bond Petticles, players must collect the required Orb cards through taking turns exchanging and drawing Orb cards.

Then, the player can 'bond' them into Petticles that are on the table by playing those cards and naming the type of bond of the Petticle: Metallic, Covalent or Ionic.

There are two modes of play, Classic and Competitive. Both use easy-to-understand rules that vary.

It is an educational game that can be played without any prior chemistry knowledge.

—description from the publisher

Name: Parade Down Tulip Lane
Description:
The object of the game is to obtain the Dutch ideals of Health, Wealth, Peace, and Plenty.  Starting at The Holland Sentinel, players will move around the board in a clockwise direction, according to the throw of the dice, until one player has accumulated:

5 Health cards
5 Peace cards
5 Plenty cards 
$1,500 in Dutch Traveler's Cheques and/or investments.

—user summary

Name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Cthugrosh
Description: A truly alien and inexplicable godlike creature from a dimension beyond human ken, Cthugrosh was summoned to Earth by the depraved sacrifices of his occult worshipers, all of whom were slain upon his arrival. Heralded as a bringer of apocalypse, Cthugrosh is one of the greatest Lords of Cthul, an entity that draws power from carnage and whose gluttony for life’s energy seems inexhaustible. Alien as his mind is, it is also immensely powerful, capable of tremendous feats of telekinesis and unleashing mind-rending surges of pure energy.

Name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Lords of Cthul Unit Expansion 1
Description:
The slug-like monstrosities called spitters follow in the wake of the proper Lords of Cthul, emitting vile and toxic fluids to digest adversaries from a distance. They can also expel this fluid to extinguish flames, though they rarely have reason to limit the destruction around them. Mighty as the Lords of Cthul may be, they sometimes deign to delegate the oversight of their conquered dominions to task masters, telekinetically powerful creatures who resemble Cthugrosh in miniature. This resemblance is no coincidence, as the killing might and cruelty of the task masters is terrifying to behold. 
Contains: 
     - Spitter (4) 
     - Task Master (1)

Name: Monsterpocalypse Miniatures Game: Lords of Cthul Unit Expansion 2
Description:
While most of the horrors brought by the Lords of Cthul slither across the ground on a multitude of turgid tentacles, the squix flaps through the skies above on bat-like wings, seeking living prey to drain of vitality. In a horrific parody of living things, meat slaves are egglike incubators formed from the flesh of former cultists and victims within which any of the still-forming minions of Cthul bubble and seethe. At the slightest disturbance, their membranes tear open to unleash the monster within.

Contains: 
     - Squix (4) 
     - Meat Slave (1)

Name: Mr. Sneaky
Description:
The players have to play different roles in this game. Each player is reading another player's mind and cheating each other. If the rich man hides a treasure tile, he can win. On the other hand, if the thief finds it, he can win. If you acquire 8 gem tokens first, you win.

--Objective--
The Rich Man: Make The Thief face up the predetermined number of cards before The Thief finds the treasure tile.
The Thief: Find the treasure tile before facing up the predetermined number of cards.

--Set up--
The Rich Man put the 8 door tiles. He hides 1 treasure tile in them. (He only knows the place of the treasure tile.)

--Course of play--
1. The Rich Man places a card face up on the door tile. 
2. The Thief faces up a door tile.
If the attribute of the door tile is equal to the attribute of the card, the card gives an effect for players.
The cards have several effects. Some cards are advantage of The Rich Man and the other cards are advantage of The Thief.

—description from the designer

Name: Alphabetta
Description:
Alphabetta is an exciting new concept Pocket Size word game. Players must decide at the start of each game which size word panel they are completing and all players use the same size.

Before starting the game, lay all letter squares face down in their colour groups in the middle of all the players. Each player gets an privacy/information Screen. Players can use the Word Panel samples on the privacy screens or complete a word panel of their choice.

To start each player throws the three dice and highest tally goes first and the other players continue in a clockwise direction. Letters are acquired by throwing the three dice and picking up one face down letter.

The aim of Alphabetta is to be the first player to complete your chosen word panel, either 3, 4 or 5 word square.

Alphabetta is primarily for 2-4 players.  Three Letter Word Squares can be played by up to 6 players in a game. The Four Letter Word Squares should be played with a recommended maximum of 3 players and Five Letter Word Squares is an excellent game with 2 people.

—description from the designer

Name: Rattus: Level Upgrades Set
Description:
The mini expansion for Rattus: Academicus contains 24 upgrade tiles for all the character cards from Rattus: Pied Piper and Rattus: Mercatus. Each tile shows Level II on one side Level III on the other, with an image of the character's face on both sides so show which character the tile applies to.

This allows you to play Module 1: The Upgrades from Rattus: Academicus with not only the 6 characters from the base game but from the two aforementioned expansions as well.

—user summary

Name: Zombicide: Invader – Zombicide: Dark Side Extras
Description:
KS Exclusives for Zombicide: Dark Side

Kickstarter exclusive crossover set including a booklet featuring 10 new Missions that mix together elements from both the Invader and Dark Side boxes. These Missions also utilize a new game mechanic: Companions that will help the Survivors in their mission.

Scientist Companions - Lukas Pavlis, Dr Markus de Vries & Olive Hayes (granting Survivors a different benefit.)

Xenos - Extra Driller Abomination, 6x Driller Blitzers (6 cards), Alt Sculpts for Driller Xenos (8x workers, 4x tanks, 4x hunters.

And, Operation Persephone, additional 10 missions combining Invader & Dark Side

Name: Elekt: Spiż
Description:
14 new cards and Iron Chariot among them - a new variant to achieve the title, one mission which is able to skip The Zone.

Ruthless Dominat on colorful illustrations.
SpiÅ¼ is a psychoactive stimulant used by the aristocracy as well as commoners. It causes strong hallucinations and feeling of a pleasure. Sometimes you can hear stories about people killed by their delusions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Elekt: Powołanie
Description:
An extension to the game Elekt, which has been created with players initiative.

16 cards with dark illustrations of the most devoted servants of Dominat. 4 basic units (4 cards each), which enriches the beginning phase of the game.

Before you start the game you should mix all basic units (standard units and those from the extension) and randomly choose 4 that will participate in the game. All players receive the same set. Of course, nobody will forbid you to play in a different way (e.g. by creating your own hand) but do it at your own risk!

—description from the publisher

Name: Elekt: Wiedźmy
Description:
Ladies of Dominat - beautiful, murderous, ruthless.

An extension to the game Elekt.


     14 cards
     intriguing illustrations
     extraordinary vibe


Illustrations on cards present nudity, violence, discrimination and scenes of crime.

—description from the publisher

Name: Catastrophic: Birds & Bees
Description:
The first expansion for Catastrophic adds 40 new cards to the game around the theme of reproduction.

This includes animal traits such as Viviparous and Oviparous, which allow your species to reproduce with live young and eggs, new plant traits for wind pollination and the use of scents and deceit to help your plants reproduce.

The expansion introduces powerful new interaction cards, and new events that your species communities will have to handle, including oil spills and meteorites!

—description from the publisher

Name: Polemos
Description:
A battle-royale, tile placement, strategical board game with grid movement and resources management mechanics.

The game starts with putting villagers on the border and each stepping to the middle tile of the side. Villagers start moving by opening new tiles. They explore new lands and mine or find resources, kill enemies, buy new soldier... But they must be afraid of The Storm. The Storm is behind them, and the safe zone is becoming smaller over time. They must fight for that zone and survive. They can mine resources, help friends, shoot from catapult, be lost in a forest an much more.

A bit detailed:

Getting Started
To start a game you need to connect borders and place tiles inside borders. Then choose a color, take 2 soldiers, open the central tile of one of the sides of hexagon and place your soldiers on it. That tile is considered as free space. It cannot harm you or be used in any ways. Place the counter on one of the corners of hexagon, which will be counting point. After finishing the preparation choose the first player by rolling the dice, the queue will be determined clockwise. The goal is to survive and be the last man standing.

Turn
Each of villagers can do one action in each turn. The actions are: moving to neighbor tile, buying another villager, killing enemy villagers. Villager can move only to neighbor tiles (the tile which has common side). He must open the unopened tile after moving on it, if the tile is not closed by the storm. He can also carry the resources with him to the new tile (maximal quantity of each resource is mentioned on villager’s section), but resources only of one type.

Villagers
A villager dies after a hit from another. To hit an enemy, villager needs to stand on the neighbor tile of the enemy and move to another neighbor tile of an enemy, which is not an abyss, another enemy. You can only kill one enemy on a tile, if the enemy villager’s number is greater than one, you can choose which on must die. Villager dies immediately, when he stands on enemy tile. Player can use only the resources, which are located in it’s villager’s tile. Player must pay one bread , if his villager’s count is more than or equal to 3, otherwise he must sacrifice one of his villagers for each unpaid turn. On one tile can be placed less than 4 villagers. You can buy new villagers by gold. Bought villager is placed on tile, where is the other villager with gold. After death of the villager all his resources stay on the same tile, and everyone can take it. If that tile is not available, the resources go to bank. If player does anything with villager, he cannot cancel it.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly Deal London
Description:
Monopoly Deal is all about collecting properties and stealing from your opponents. Use action cards to charge rent, swap cards, demand birthday money and lots more. Make sure you put lots of money into your personal bank, remember other players will steal from you too. 
Not your usual Monopoly Deal game, instead of streets you have to collect places such as museums, restaurants and other locations. A quick, easy, fun game which only takes 20 minutes to play, great for playing on the go.

All property cards contain photographs of famous features of the London landscape such as Saint Paul’s, Big Ben and the Houses of Parliament, as well as more recent favourites such as the London Dungeon and London Transport Museum.

The new action cards feature famous images from around London, including the It’s My Birthday action card depicting Harrods.

The cards also include the nearest tube station to guide tourists directly to the landmarks while the popular Monopoly tokens depict modes of transport around the city, such as taxis, buses, tubes and the river bus.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kaiju Stadium
Description:
Kaiju Stadium is a two-player strategy game about giant monsters playing sports. In it, you make use of dice, play cards, and unique kaiju abilities to pull off wild combinations and score points against your opponent.

Each turn, you roll two dice and pick from them to decide what you're going to do with that turn.
