The dice give you movement options, let you kick the ball, and more, plus you have access to limited-use Play cards that let you do things that aren't on the dice. Beyond that, every kaiju has a pair of unique special abilities: one that modifies how it interacts with the basic rules of the game (e.g. Hyperion can trample through opposing kaiju while moving) and one that happens when they switch onto the field from the sidelines (e.g. Nimbus can steal the ball from a nearby space). You're going to spend each turn making decisions about who to move, who to have on the field, and what to do with your kaiju, trying to solve the ongoing puzzle of "can I score a point this turn or not?"

Get the ball into the opponent's goal to score a point. The game is over when a player can reach three or more points with a two point lead or when either play reaches five points.

Rounds take about 15-30 minutes and the game rarely unfolds the exact same way twice, so the game is meant to be played several times in a row.

Name: Brexit: The Board Game of Second Chances
Description:
Brexit: The Board Game of Second Chances is a dice-rolling, strategic-token placement game that is easy to learn, but provides depth for experienced gamers. It is also steeped in parody--both through artwork and flavor text--concerning the EU Referendum. Whether you supported Leave, Remain, or just like to see political figures taken to task, there’s something here for you to laugh about. (There’s also fact cards, with actual facts relevant to the issues of the EU Referendum…ones neither campaign seemed to actually use.)

In a Nutshell:
Each player chooses a campaign (Leave or Remain) then cooperates with that campaign to defeat the other campaign. There are two primary game mechanics: (1) rolling dice to match symbols on cards that provide effects, and (2) using those effects to strategically place campaign tokens on a map (or remove your opponents). The campaign that claims a majority of the map first, wins. Players can also use effects to sabotage the opposing campaign.

A Player's Turn:
A player rolls argument dice and tries to match the symbols on the dice (representing arguments relevant to the EU Referendum) with the symbols on headline cards. Matching all the symbols on a headline card grants the player various effects--from advancing the player's side on the map (and thus winning over voters) to sabotaging another player (by blocking that player from rerolling, using wilds, or advancing that player's side on the map).

The campaign that flips three of the five voting regions first--by placing three tokens on a region or through other game effects--wins the vote and the game.

Brexit: The Board Game of Second Chances provides humorous content with accessible, quick-to-learn, but dynamic gameplay. It's perfect for a mix of skilled and new gamers, or as a fun distraction on an otherwise long and serious gaming session.

Name: Tactic All Stars Coach Collectible Card Game
Description:
In this collectible card game players take the role of the soccer team managers.

Each player is given 6000 currency to spent on players for their team. The same player may not be chosen twice.

After the teams have been chosen it is time to play soccer. Each player has their own board where they put their player cards. Both players start with a ball on their goal keepper. The ball is moved by rolling a dice and players do so in turn. With 1-2 the ball goes backwards, 3 sideways and 4-6 forward. If the ball can't move back it stays where it is.

When a player gets the ball to attacking zone a kick occurs. The attacking player throws the dice again and adds the value to the kickers attack value. Defending player checks the defending value of the goalkeeper and the player of his who has the ball and counts them together. If the attacker has a bigger sum the kick is a goal, and if defending sum is bigger the game continues.

The game ends when an agreed number of goals is made.

This is basically a two player game, but can be plaid with multiple people as a tournament.
